pullRequest.body:
Replace manual `measurability` calls with `fun_prop`; replace `measurability` calls by `fun_prop` when possible.
As a by-product, this tags a few more lemmas `fun_prop` and resolves all porting notes involving `measurability`.

Follow- up to #13770.

---

- [x] depends on: #13869

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/39de7ec1-c3a8-44d8-8042-69f1dbcc65c8) for commit 7cce13315500a0cb81c01aeed705af6895e44cf3.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/79da473c-d0da-4e65-aa57-c79d00e0bd4c/to/39de7ec1-c3a8-44d8-8042-69f1dbcc65c8) against commit 59c05f4a165a84f71eb0ac90afafcdd04a7bd5c5:
```diff
  Benchmark                                            Metric         Change
  ==========================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.JapaneseBracket   instructions   -64.8%
```

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#13869~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@RemyDegenne This is the follow-up PR I promised; I guess you're interested. It does even yield some slight speed-ups.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a5629cd5-7ede-4a01-9c57-7a82a9d3316c) for commit 72b694e97d45481fd6f23a27c37d4346f7a0dc49.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/80e42cc0-abfe-4d6a-ba53-e962bbf507dc/to/a5629cd5-7ede-4a01-9c57-7a82a9d3316c) against commit ae6dfcde3c2ba01f5902e8b84a40a87cb94abf5e:
```diff
  Benchmark                                            Metric         Change
  ==========================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.JapaneseBracket   instructions   -64.3%
```

Comparing the two benchmarking runs, the second one is a minor improvement (save for `CircleIntegral`, which is very slightly slower - I would say this is a fair trade-off for the increased automation).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9940802279/job/27458397716)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9940802279/job/27458398743)
Three questions I asked myself: mainly about the `fun_prop` tagging.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```
Flagging this for the future: it would be nice to avoid the `Measurable.aestronglyMeasurable` lemma; `fun_prop` should infer this instead.
Just to be clear, in order for that to work properly, we need to mark `AEStronglyMeasurable` (the definition) with the `fun_prop` attribute. (EDIT: I see you did in this PR)
I am not sure if `continuous_norm` should be tagged `fun_prop` instead.

@lecopivo This lemma follows from `continuous_norm` above - should this lemma be tagged fun_prop, the lemma above or both? (Is this documented somewhere; I'm happy to read the docs instead of pinging you every time!)

Not documented yet, I'm working on documentation. Right now, keep on pinging me to I can see what kind of questions come up and I can include them in the doc. 

Yes it can be inferred from continuity but providing specialized measurability theorem will make proofs about norm faster as `fun_prop` does not have to do as many steps.
Thanks for the quick answer!
Perhaps `continuous_circleMap` should get tagged `fun_prop` instead...

`XXX` is pretty useless as an indicator. Can we just leave `TODO`?

Also, flagging this for myself to understand in depth why this doesn't work.

Sure - obviously, my preferred outcome is to make `fun_prop` work. If fixing that is for another PR, feel free to apply the following:
```suggestion
  -- TODO: make `fun_prop` able to handle this
